title: The Clever Tortoise
text: In a quiet forest, a tortoise and a hare decided to race. The hare sprinted quickly and soon felt confident he would win. He stopped to rest under a tree and fell asleep. The tortoise kept moving slowly but steadily. When the hare finally woke up, he ran to the finish line, but the tortoise had already crossed it. The animals learned that steady effort can beat careless speed.

title: Rainy Day Science
text: Rain forms when tiny drops of water in clouds join together. When the drops become heavy, they fall as rain. People measure rain with a tool called a rain gauge. If the air is cold enough, the drops freeze and fall as snow instead. Weather scientists, called meteorologists, collect this data to make forecasts.

title: A Trip to the Museum
text: Mina visited the city museum on Saturday. She saw ancient pottery, colorful paintings, and a tall dinosaur skeleton. A guide explained how fossils form over millions of years. In the gift shop, Mina bought a small book about dinosaurs to share with her class on Monday.
